page.title: 01High Lorton and Whinlatter.
page.content: This area,on the north-western edge of the{Lake District National Park,}is principally one of{fell}and{forest,} with the small village of{High Lorton in its south-western corner. Apart from forestry plantation,the village and some cultivated fields,by far the largest proportion of it is taken up by {sheep-pasture},either in enclosed fields or on the open fell. Running across the south-western corner is the B5292,linking the towns of Cockermouth and Keswick.At High Lorton the road begins climbing to cross{Whinlatter Pass},most of which is planted with conifers and forms part of{Thornthwaite Forest.} The village of High Lorton consists of traditional slate houses,several more modern bungalows and a few outlying farms.It has a church,primary school,inn and post-office/shop.
